The way you worded it was hostile. I understand if you did not mean it that way but that's how it comes across.
Exactly. I'm slightly concerned that I'm going to get punched through my monitor now.

Here let me explain then, {{item:3361}} costs** 250 **g.

{{item:3361}} increases the capability of to hold **2** wards, while doubling your ward output, and that they last for full ward durations (180 seconds)**each** instead of 120 seconds, meaning it can and will allow you to have 3 wards on the map after 3 minutes without you ever having to buy a single ward for the rest of the game (assuming enemy isn't killing them). 

Another way to look it is grants **12.5g** per 10 in terms of value for wards, that's higher than any of the gp10 items and **cheaper**. The non-upgraded one grants you about 4.167g per 10 in terms of value for wards, it's literally 3 times as effective for just 250g, meaning assuming you use effectively it {{item:3361}} will have payed for itself in just** 5 **minutes vs using {{item:3340}} and buying {{item:2044}}s. 

And this ignoring the crazy appeal of the other trinkets.
I love math. I love efficiency. I love math that proves efficiency. Have my upvote.

eff=Output/Input x 100%

Out>9000g
In= 250g

eff=hkhdkjhsrohirskhrikhr

The efficiency of this trinket is too damn high.
Someone go open up MS Paint and make this meme.  I'm at work, so it sadly can't be me.
You don't have to explain it to *me*.
No one said he was, why are you being so snooty? Seriously, you came off okay in the beginning, but now you're just acting like a jerk.

That makes no sense. The purpose of this was to determine what was the best way for him to get the word out. Replying to an obscure comment to someone who doesn't need to be told is definitely not the way.

But the point is, you're replying to ALL of the comments in a way that makes other people feel like they're being looked down upon, because the way you're saying things make it seem like that.  Plus, you're not helping to spread the word by replying to all of these comments, and you're adding nothing to the conversation. 
You replied to someone who had done the math on why upgrading ward trinkets was good, because previously you said that adding details as to why upgrading was good. After that person had explained the math TO ALL OF US, you replied to him with:

"You don't have to explain it to *me.*"

He wasn't talking to you in SPECIFIC. He was talking to the rest of the people who read this thread who wanted some specific values on how and why upgrading ward trinkets was a good idea.  You replying to him, in such a snooty manner, leads  me to believe that you're just an ornery person who is desperately trying to justify being snooty on the internet.
Oh, and your use of sarcasm, isn't helping your case either.

250 gold for a trinket thats a better version of sightstone - on any champion. Even if none of the other trinkets appeal to you, not upgrading and not buying any wards is like the noobest thing you can possibly do.

One thing I hate as support Velkoz is trying to explain to people why an upgraded trinket is way more useful for me than wasting an item slot (and 800/1600 gold) on sightstone. It doesn't matter if you tell them that the upgraded trinket can have the max amount of wards out at once, or saying that by ignoring sightstone you get haunting guise/cdr item earlier for a power spike while keeping max vision.

It's like arguing with people who are devout traditionalists (aka impossible). The only argument you could really make is that you can't upgrade until level 9 which is ~14 minutes into the game, but before then you really only need a trinket ward in river and the odd 75 gold ward for anything else.

You are playing supports wrong. You should always get the Sightstone as a support. If you want your "power spike" then stop being a wannabe APC and go mid ffs, and let people who actually know how to play support go bot instead. The higher you go, the more you will start losing games since you will fuk up your bot lane with that playstyle of yours.

The yellow trinket is trash on supports, since like you said you can only upgrade it so late... and also you have no reliable way of denying enemy vision if you do not get the Sweeper.

Yes, that's exactly why I have a 70% winrate with Velkoz support, because my playstyle is trash for not following the way others want me to play.

I don't even understand your reason for hating a "wannabe apc". Why is a support not allowed to do damage? Why does a support need a red trinket when it would be much more useful on the jungler, and when a team only needs one upgraded red? I can't even solo drag if I found an opening as support. I wouldn't even call 14 minutes late for an upgrade because the average match length is 40 minutes.

There's even a benefit to having an AP support bot because of how many AD mids there are, and even if there was an AP mid you can't really cry about them stacking magic resist because of Vel's passive. There's a reason why I always have the highest damage on the team as support Vel.

Since you don't have lot of vision early + no red trincket, the jungle can't ganks because it's either a waste of time ( enemies wards) or risky (lack of vision). It will be harder to secure / ward drakes, and a decent jungle will get free drakes and camp your lane early game.
Also, two red trincket is better,  the jungle can't secure drake/nashors and clean the wards of 3 people alone.

Vision win games. Especialy when the match is pretty close.

14 wins and 6 losses.

Real good sample size for you 70% winrate.

I will admit, that could be worse, but maybe you should play 100+ before commenting on your "playstyle". That's like spitting out one line of philosophy and trying to write a book with it.

I'd say that's a fairly large sample size for just a single champion, considering that last season my most played champs were Skarner and Darius with about 70 games each. If 20 games isn't enough just add in my 47 games from Season 4, Vel hasn't been changed much at all since S4, and people on the forums seem to think that 55% winrate makes someone op anyways.

Who even has the time for playing +100 games on a single champ in one year and not get bored anyways? With 450 games played last season none of my champs have over 80 games, and that would make sense because there are 5 positions on a team and if you don't care what position you play you'll play every position equally. So to play 100 games of Velkoz (assuming I don't switch the support I main in that time) I would need to play on average of 500 games.

Yeah, I'll send you a pm when I play 333 hours of league this year, but by then the thing I was trying to prove would be invalid because of the evolving nature of league.

I try to tell even friends this. One game in particular annoyed me, when he was playing ADC splitpushing, got ganked, and then said to the support, "Hey X, we need more wards on the map." The supports response was great though because he said, "Bitch, there's a store you're at since you're dead, go buy some." 

There's no excuse for you to go the whole game and not upgrade it, I don't care if you're and AD carry, Mid Laner, especially Top laner, whatever. It's the team's job to ward.

The League community uses "PSA" a lot.  I do not think it means what they think it means.

Public Service Announcement. The (League-playing) *public* would be better *served* if everyone upgraded their god damned trinkets, and OP was *announcing* it, so I think it counts.

Also, sarcastic hyperbole may have come into play at some point.

1. Lack of vision IS stupidity.  Especially if it comes from not buying the most powerful 250g items in the game.

2. Usually it's someone else who facechecked and died, not the person complaining about how their team doesn't pay enough attention to vision.  Although not always.

If we're going with the least charitable interpretation, yeah, maybe that happened. Personally, as a support main who usually has three wards out at any given time, it also grinds my gears when others don't upgrade their trinkets.

(Also, why do you care the precise definition of PSA? If it wasn't one in the strictest sense, chalk it up to rhetorical irony and move on.)
